importantInfo.title: Important Information for Employers
importantInfo.description: Ukrainian refugees with temporary protection status have access to the Dutch labor market without a work permit. Employers only need to report to the UWV. Here are some points to consider:

noWorkPermit.title: No Work Permit Needed
noWorkPermit.description: Ukrainian refugees can work without additional permits. However, a report must be made to the UWV, where you specify the position, location, and working hours. After this report, they can start working within two business days.

languageSupport.title: Language and Integration Support
languageSupport.description: Take advantage of schemes such as subsidies for language support and workplace guidance.

employmentTerms.title: Employment Terms
employmentTerms.description: Ukrainian workers are entitled to the same employment terms as other employees, including fair wages, safe working conditions, and an employment contract.

temporaryProtection.title: Temporary Protection Extended
temporaryProtection.description: The temporary protection for Ukrainian refugees has been extended until March 4, 2026, meaning they can continue working in the Netherlands without concerns during this period.

costs.title: Costs and Collaboration
costs.description: The use of our platform is completely free for Ukrainian refugees. For employers, a fee is charged depending on your specific requirements and the number of candidates you are looking for. This fee is flexible and can be tailored to your needs. Contact us to discuss which options best suit your company and to receive a quote tailored to your situation.

q1.question: Do Ukrainian refugees need a work permit in the Netherlands?
q1.answer: No, Ukrainian refugees do not need a separate work permit to work in the Netherlands. Once you have received your temporary protection status and BSN number, you can legally work for any employer in the Netherlands.

q2.question: Is Ukraine2Work free to use for job seekers?
q2.answer: Yes, Ukraine2Work is completely free for Ukrainian job seekers. There are no fees or charges for creating an account, building a profile, searching for jobs, or applying to positions.

q3.question: How can employers verify Ukrainian qualifications?
q3.answer: The Netherlands has institutions that can help evaluate and recognize Ukrainian diplomas and qualifications. We can assist employers in contacting these credential evaluation services and guide them through the process.

q4.question: What languages do I need to know to work in the Netherlands?
q4.answer: Language requirements depend on the specific job. Many international companies operate in English, and for these positions, Ukrainian candidates often only need English proficiency. For other positions, Dutch may be required. Our job listings clearly indicate language requirements.

q5.question: How can I find housing in the Netherlands?
q5.answer: While Ukraine2Work focuses primarily on employment, we understand housing is a critical need. We have partnerships with organizations that provide temporary housing assistance for Ukrainian refugees, and our resources section has information about finding long-term accommodation.

q6.question: What salary can I expect in the Netherlands?
q6.answer: Salaries depend on your field, experience level, and location within the Netherlands. The Dutch minimum wage is â¬1,934.40 per month (as of 2023) for full-time work for adults. Many professional positions offer higher salaries. Our job listings include salary information when available.

q7.question: Can employers get tax benefits for hiring Ukrainian refugees?
q7.answer: Dutch employers may be eligible for various subsidies and tax benefits when hiring Ukrainian refugees, depending on circumstances. These can include wage cost subsidies and tax breaks for job training. Our employer resources guide covers available programs in detail.

q8.question: How can I improve my CV for the Dutch job market?
q8.answer: The Dutch job market has specific preferences for CV formatting and content. We provide free CV templates specifically designed for Ukrainian professionals entering the Dutch job market, as well as personalized resume review services through our partner organizations.

legal.title: What You Need to Know as a Ukrainian Refugee in the Netherlands
legal.description: Under the EU Temporary Protection Directive, Ukrainian refugees can work in the Netherlands without a work permit. This means that after registering with the municipality and obtaining an O-document (proof of residence), you can immediately start looking for a job. It is important that you register with the IND (Immigration and Naturalization Service) within four weeks to legalize your stay and work status.

workPermit.title: Work permit
workPermit.description: Ukrainian refugees do not need a work permit to do paid work in the Netherlands. Employers are required to register you with the UWV before you start working.

equalRights.title: Equal rights
equalRights.description: As a Ukrainian refugee, you have the same rights as Dutch workers, such as fair wages, safe working conditions, and access to health insurance.

temporaryProtection.title: Temporary protection
temporaryProtection.description: The temporary protection for Ukrainian refugees has been extended until March 4, 2026. This means you can continue working in the Netherlands until then.

howToFindWork.title: How to Find Work?
howToFindWork.description: At Ukraine2Work, we help you step by step. You just need to create your profile on our platform, where we ask about your skills, work experience, and ambitions. Our system ensures that you are quickly matched with the right employers in various sectors.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Do you have questions about working in the Netherlands or need support in finding work? Contact us, and we'll be happy to help you further.

residencePermit.question: What if I don't have proof of residence yet?
residencePermit.answer: Make sure to register with the municipality where you are staying and make an appointment with the IND to collect your O-document. Without this proof, you are not allowed to work.

volunteer.question: Can I work as a volunteer?
volunteer.answer: Yes, Ukrainian refugees can do volunteer work without a work permit.
